title: New boss of audit watchdog fails to publish his own accounts on time
text:
The new chairman of the City’s audit watchdog failed to file accounts for his property investment company on time - and is now applying to have the company struck off.

Former top banker Simon Dingemans took up his new £150,000-a-year role at the Financial Reporting Council (FRC) on Tuesday and is responsible for policing the behaviour of Britain's beancounters.

According to filings at Companies House, accounts for Mr Dingemans’ property investment firm Grenofen Investments are nearly ten months overdue.

An application to strike the company off the register was filed in mid-August, having been signed by both Mr Dingemans and his wife in July, shortly after it was alleged that Mr Dingemans failed...
description: The new chairman of the City’s audit watchdog failed to file accounts for his property investment company on time - and is now applying to have the company struck off.
